verses.roman:
iti cintayatas tasya
dṛṣṭāriṣṭena cetasā
rājñaḥ pratyāgamad brahman
yadu-puryāḥ kapi-dhvajaḥ

synonyms: iti—thus; cintayataḥ—while thinking to himself; tasya—he; dṛṣṭā—by observing; ariṣṭena—bad omens; cetasā—by the mind; rājñaḥ—the King; prati—back; āgamat—came; brahman—O brāhmaṇa; yadu-puryāḥ—from the kingdom of the Yadus; kapi-dhvajaḥ—Arjuna.
translation: O Brāhmaṇa Śaunaka, while Mahārāja Yudhiṣṭhira, observing the inauspicious signs on the earth at that time, was thus thinking to himself, Arjuna came back from the city of the Yadus [Dvārakā].
